FlightplanDB docs¶

class FlightPlanDB(key: Optional[str] = None, url_base: str = 'https://api.flightplandatabase.com')¶

This class mostly contains internal functions called by the API. However, the internal functions are hidden, so unless you look at the source code, you're unlikely to see them.

Submodules are accessed via the alias properties at the end; for instance, flightplandb.plan.fetch()

Parameters

  • key (Optional[str]) -- API token, defaults to None (which makes it unauthenticated)

  • url_base (str) -- The host of the API endpoint URL, defaults to https://api.flightplandatabase.com

property version¶

API version that returned the response

Returns

API version

Return type

int

property units¶

The units system used for numeric values. https://flightplandatabase.com/dev/api#units

Returns

AVIATION, METRIC or SI

Return type

str

property limit_cap¶

The number of requests allowed per day, operated on an hourly rolling basis. i.e requests used between 19:00 and 20:00 will become available again at 19:00 the following day. API key authenticated requests get a higher daily rate limit and can be raised if a compelling use case is presented.

Returns

number of allowed requests per day

Return type

int

property limit_used¶

The number of requests used in the current period by the presented API key or IP address

Returns

number of requests used in period

Return type

int

ping() → flightplandb.datatypes.StatusResponse¶

Checks API status to see if it is up

Returns

OK 200 means the service is up and running.

Return type

StatusResponse

revoke() → flightplandb.datatypes.StatusResponse¶

Revoke the API key in use in the event it is compromised.

Requires authentication.

Returns

If the HTTP response code is 200 and the status message is "OK", then the key has been revoked and any further requests will be rejected. Any other status code or message indicates an error has occurred and the errors array will give further details.

Return type

StatusResponse

Alias for PlanAPI()
